result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew N Spiegelhoff was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-THC(>200-1000g), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)2.
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 3 years bifurcated sentence.  Eligible for CIP and SAP only after serving 40% of the confinement time.
Concurrent with: 20CF1173.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.
Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.  Online business does not apply.  May attend school full time.  May attend school part time and work part time.

No contact with the victim (third party, social media, person, property, residence or family).  Do not drive on the street where J.S. resides.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent.  Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation. Firearm warning given. Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement.

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 2 years bifurcated sentence.  Eligible for CIP and SAP only after serving 40% of the confinement time.
Concurrent with: Ct. 1 and 20CF1173.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Conditions are as outlined in Ct. 1.

10:28 AM Defendant Matthew N Spiegelhoff in court.  Attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty in court for Matthew N Spiegelhoff.  Attorney Brian Van Schyndel in court for State of Wisconsin. DAR Court Reporter Amanda Chentnik.  Parties have reviewed the PSI and make additions and corrections.  There is no victim present on the Zoom meeting.  State is in Marcy's Law compliance. State has filed Victim impact statements just this morning.  There is a restitution requests for $2000, $1000 and $400, and $2700, $300.  There was a codefendant who has already been sentenced and may have been ordered joint and several restitution.  The State would ask the court to order the restitution joint and several.  Parties make sentencing arguments.

Ct. 4- 8 YR. WPS., 4 YR. IC AND 4 YR. ES.
20CF1570:

Ct. 2- 2 YR. WPS, 1 YR. IC AND 1 YR. ES.  CONCURRENT TO CT. 1.  CONCURRENT TO 20CF1173.

Conditions:
No contact with the victims (third party, social media, person, property, residence or family).  Do not drive on the street J.S. lives.
No alcohol or controlled substances to be monitored by random UA's/breathalyzers.  AODA assessment and any follow through with any recommendations from agent.
Obtain and Maintain full time employment outside of online business.  Document job search and provide to agent. OR Full time schooling or part time schooling and employment. 
Restitution M.H. $300.00.
Restitution to J.S. and D.S. $6,888.00.
Court Costs.
DNA Sample and Surcharge.
FAW/Vote.
Eligible for CIP and SAP only after serving 40% of the confinement time.

9:16 AM Defendant Matthew N Spiegelhoff in court.  Attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty in court for Matthew N Spiegelhoff.  Attorney Brian Van Schyndel in court for State of Wisconsin. records.addlTxt: atty Preston
Racine County Pretrial Risk Assessment Report

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

1:52 PM Prosecuting attorney Antoinette L. Rich appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Matthew N Spiegelhoff appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez appeared by video for Matthew N Spiegelhoff. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Initial appearance on March 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
